name: TheAtlantic
text: "As always, we should be reflexively skeptical of surprising exit polls. This year in particular, we should be cautious about drawing overconfident conclusions from early results," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/8NCzbpAPLT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders make up 4 percent of Pennsylvania’s voting-age population. @shuranphoto and @erjlee photographed 12 of these voters and asked them who they’re supporting and why. https://t.co/VWp0zslcw0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch parties have been part of presidential elections for years. But with a deadly pandemic at hand, a rule-flouting leader in office, and life-changing policies on the line, this year feels different for many Americans, @cray_kate reports: https://t.co/91GSaw1tAd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: A QAnon believer is heading to Congress. Read about this dangerous cult here: 
https://t.co/VA6RTP1gTd

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Counting ballots takes time—whether they are cast in person or by mail, and nothing requires that the process arbitrarily stop on Election Day. This has always been true. Nothing is different this round," @kimwehle writes: https://t.co/BrLBp6gDvF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jeff Bezos is now ready to start giving some of the $10 billion he pledged to help fight climate change. But his gifts indicate that he isn’t trying something new so much as boosting an ancien régime, @yayitsrob reports: https://t.co/BQeelKQNad

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @cray_kate: If you’re feeling stressed and watching election results on your own, you’re not the only one. Election night watch parties have a long history, but their irreverence can be difficult to reconcile with this year’s high stakes. https://t.co/RT3wEeaPNu

name: TheAtlantic
text: America’s hands-off approach to regulating vehicles and driving provides an ongoing opportunity for violent extremists, @greg_shill writes: https://t.co/WlRHzVg0Ee

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2016 can feel like it was either yesterday or a lifetime ago. @jpinsk reflects on how elections play with our sense of time: https://t.co/uCWFjccIUM

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: Prescient story from @realcpaz, who’s been trying to tell you about Latino voters. https://t.co/to1bvFtl1M

name: TheAtlantic
text: "On this 25th anniversary of his death, I will honor the friend I loved, and pray that Yitzhak’s blessed memory will continue to inspire those he lived and died for to go forward with vision, faith, understanding, and courage," @BillClinton writes: https://t.co/sNquW2kczH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: "Even without the results, though, there are some lessons to draw from the race already. State-level polls suggesting a rosy outlook for Biden seem to have been badly off."  https://t.co/5R7JvtdqHh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Read this now: https://t.co/YSb1NxcWh3

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Trump's early-morning demand to stop counting valid votes stands against election law and would disenfranchise millions of voters, @GrahamDavidA writes.

https://t.co/TSJTUNaySk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: While you were (maybe?) sleeping, from @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/GsOdYljN7D

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "The world watched today as the president confirmed his critics’—and American allies’—fears, railing baselessly against election fraud, arguing from his perch in the White House that he had won an election whose result remained in doubt." https://t.co/sWFT6HXdmr

name: TheAtlantic
text: As America awaits the presidential-election result, @GrahamDavidA examines how the uncertainty will test the strength of our democratic institutions: https://t.co/nJFimJzsJT https://t.co/AHjfJh1TdS

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "It was a chilling appearance by a president who has tried for months to undermine faith in the election and has not committed to accepting its result."
https://t.co/evT11ksisT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gillianbwhite: If you’re sick of keeping up with the pundits  and tracking slow moving counts https://t.co/5SxJOoyXuJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: What means are actually at Trump’s disposal to subvert the results of this election? @bartongellman walks through three possible scenarios—and how Biden’s team has prepared for them: https://t.co/nU8Fck9IXF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: Feeling like this @IsaacDovere piece is holding up real well today: https://t.co/Ekwem1tLEw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Donald Trump will never really go away... Not on November 4, not on January 20, not when he dies, not in a hundred years." https://t.co/VWdUf8L1uz

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The real catastrophe is that the failure of the polls leaves Americans with no reliable way to understand what we as a people think outside of elections—which in turn threatens our ability to make choices, or to cohere as a nation," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/qQhezCwrfy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Read @GrahamDavidA all day long to figure out what's what:

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: The shifting climate will be the backdrop of our lives and one of the major moral questions of the century. To understand it, check out Planet, The Atlantic’s new section on climate change. Presented by @Citi. https://t.co/RZoB5RnNFJ https://t.co/IpWacBRh2f

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @TomMcTague: An invitation: Come this way for a slice of De Tocqueville and a dollop of LBJ, a helping of MacArthur and a portion of Truman.

But stay, if you can, for the reflection on America itself, its enduring strength and its new sense of fragility. https://t.co/LtIsqmlvrX

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jaime Harrison did not beat Lindsey Graham, but he expanded Democrats' vision of what is possible in the Deep South, @AdamHSays writes: https://t.co/vap4dnB5zY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Trump-Biden race was a test of national character, and it looks likely that the United States will pass, if only just," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/dr4FpYLpSI

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We are stuck with one another, seeing no way out and no apparent way through, sinking deeper into a state of mutual incomprehension and loathing," George Packer writes: https://t.co/LmHnTUDxcT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Are 270 Electoral College votes enough? @jbenton asks. Sure, if you trust all of your electors not to go rogue … https://t.co/bowHefWd6S

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "The votes show that progressives’ habit of seeing Americans as molecules dissolved in vast and undifferentiated ethnic and racial solutions without individual agency is both analytically misleading and politically self-defeating..." 
-- George Packer:
